Carlsbad has a relaxed oceanfront atmosphere away from the madness of
, but close enough for easy access. It has beaches that are better maintained than its northern neighbor
.  South of Carlsbad is the beach town of

.

Carlsbad is also a favorite destination for foreign tourists, especially Germans.

For families with young children, Carlsbad's biggest draw is Legoland California, a theme park based on the popular toy line with sculptures made of the little plastic bricks and lots of Lego-themed rides.
Carlsbad is located about 30 miles north of
on Interstate 5. The Coast Highway (County Route S21) passes through Carlsbad as well.

Carlsbad has two train stations: Carlsbad Village (on State Street just north of Grand Avenue) on the north side and Carlsbad Poinsettia (on Avenida Encinas between Palomar Airport Road and Poinsettia Lane) on the south side. Both can be reached via the
regional rail line, which runs between
(northern neighbor of Carlsbad) and the Santa Fe Depot in downtown

.

If you are traveling from Los Angeles or Orange County, a limited number of
trains (three trains in each direction) stop at both Carlsbad stations. Alternately, take
to the Oceanside Transit Center. From the Oceanside Transit Center, take the COASTER, a bus, or a taxi to Carlsbad.
) has commercial commuter flights to Los Angeles on United Express and to North Las Vegas on Vision Airlines, as well as general aviation.

) is the closest major airport to Carlsbad.   From SAN, you may take San Diego Transit's Route 992 bus to the Santa Fe Depot, connect to the COASTER, and get off at the COASTER stations at either Carlsbad Poinsettia or Carlsbad Village.
) in Orange County is the next closest major airport; the nearest Amtrak/Metrolink stations are in Santa Ana, Tustin, and Irvine.
provides public bus service within Carlsbad.

content=A chain of unique restaurants spanning California and several other western states which has its roots in the San Diego area and is headquartered in Carlsbad. Try an Original Fish Taco.

Gluten-Free Dining:  If you are on a gluten-free diet you are in for treat.  The following restaurants are located in Carlsbad Village and are walking distance from the train station:  Pizza Port offers delicious gluten-free pizza and carries gluten-free beers and ciders.  For Mexican dining try Garcia's, Norte, and Las Olas all of who can provide gluten-free options.  Several Italian restaurants will substitute gluten-free pasta including Caldo Pomodoro and Vigilucci's.  O'Sullivan's Irish Pub offers bangers and mash plus traditional corned beef (ask for no whiskey sauce).  The Coyote Bar and Grill has an excellent roasted half chicken and other menu options that can be made gluten-free.

value: directions=Across from the Carlsbad Premium Outlet Mall
content=St John Knit, Outlet. Boutique style store with range of St John signature collections and great prices.

content=Beer enthusiasts will want to check out this place, which was featured in the Beer Advocate's Top 50 places to drink beer in America. The pub is family-friendly, and the California-style pizza is a local favorite.  They also host local beer-tastings and microbrew events.
address=300 Carlsbad Village Dr #211, Carlsbad, CA 92008

content=Fresh coffee, tea and food in a comfortable coffee shop atmosphere. It's upstairs in the center of the Village Faire shopping center.

content=A seaside resort located adjacent to Carlsbad State Beach. Each condo has full kitchens, fireplaces and balconies with views. Two ocean view pools, lighted tennis and basketball courts, a putting green and fitness center.
content=Studio's with mini kitchens up to two bedroom three bath full condo's
content=Formerly the Four Seasons Aviara, this is a fine luxury resort, which features a golf course designed by Arnold Palmer.
content=A resort overlooking the California flower fields, less than a mile from the beach. Across the street from a pedestrian entrance to Legoland.
content=An all-suite hotel with fully-equipped kitchens. Complimentary hot breakfast daily, dinner with beer and wine Monday-Thursday, and high-speed Internet.
content=Hot breakfast, Hi-speed Internet, parking, outdoor heated pool, fitness center, in-room fridge/microwave all included in rate. Walking distance to beach.
content=Panoramic Pacific Ocean views from hotel and its 20 Grill & Wine Bar. Expansive free-form swimming pool and unique, marine-based treatments in its spa.
